data.title: Access and Infrastructure
data.description: Barriers related to physical access, technological infrastructure, financial capacity, and the presence of local facilitators.

data.title: Digital Literacy Disparities
data.description: Limited access to devices, internet, and the skills to use them effectively.

data.title: Rural Infrastructure Deficits
data.description: Rural communities face challenges in broadband access, educational institutions, and transportation.

data.title: Limited Resources
data.description: Government and NGOs may not prioritize or fund media literacy initiatives adequately.

data.title: Language Barriers
data.description: Non-English speakers lack access to accurate, culturally appropriate, and multilingual content.

data.title: Lack of Trusted Local Facilitators
data.description: Communities lack credible local educators or mediators who can translate and contextualize information.

data.title: Education and Policy
data.description: System-level barriers in schools and leadership structures that prevent effective media literacy and misinformation resilience.

data.title: Educational System Limitations
data.description: Curriculum and teacher training are inadequate for fostering critical digital and media literacy.

data.title: Influence of Local Leaders
data.description: Community leaders may spread misinformation due to lack of training or pressure to conform.

data.title: Curriculum Rigidity and Policy Vacuum
data.description: There are few state-level mandates or support for integrating media literacy into school systems.

data.title: Absence of Local Prebunking Strategies
data.description: No locally adapted campaigns exist to proactively educate the public before misinformation spreads.

data.title: Culture and Psychosocial Dynamics
data.description: Cultural norms and mental/emotional states that make communities more or less resilient to misinformation.

data.title: Cultural Resistance to Change
data.description: Deeply rooted values and skepticism toward outside perspectives hinder adaptability.

data.title: Socioeconomic Challenges
data.description: Poverty, unemployment, and class divides can create grievances that misinformation exploits.

data.title: Political Polarization
data.description: Partisan identity and echo chambers reinforce misinformation acceptance.

data.title: Psychosocial Drivers of Susceptibility
data.description: Stress, loneliness, identity threats, and social fragmentation increase misinformation vulnerability.

data.title: Information Ecosystem and Trust
data.description: Issues in the media landscape and local communication structures that hinder access to accurate information.

data.title: Media Trust Issues
data.description: Widespread skepticism toward traditional media reduces information credibility.

data.title: Echo Chambers and Algorithmic Bias
data.description: Platforms reinforce existing beliefs, preventing exposure to counterpoints.

data.title: No Rapid Local Fact-Check Infrastructure
data.description: Communities lack responsive, locally grounded mechanisms to verify circulating claims quickly.
